citations.narrative:
***USDA observed the public feeding feed provided by the zoo to the llamas, goats, sheep , bovine and Yak throughout
the park. There was no readily identifiable attendant observed to be monitoring the public interaction at any point during
the inspection. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant must be present at all times
during periods of public interaction. Correct by April 18, 2023.

***The first enclosure to the left upon entering the park has a long black plastic feed trough that has been broken on both
ends leaving large holes in the bottom which could allow the goats and sheep to become injured when climbing into it.
There is an A framed shelter provided at the end of the pen that has been damaged leaving boards unattached and laying
on the ground in the enclosure. All structures in the enclosure shall be repaired or replaced to protect the animals from
possible injuries. Correct by April 18, 2023
***The fence at the pig enclosure has several fence boards that have been knocked out by the pigs. There are large holes
dug out in the areas where the boards have been knocked off of the fence and the wire is no longer supported. The holes
created below the fence line leave gaps as large as 18 inches in some areas which may allow animals housed in the
enclosure to escape, or unwanted access to wild or stray animals. The fence shall be repaired or replaced to secure the
animals within their enclosure as well as protect them from unwanted animal access. Correct by April 18, 2023
***The fence for the enclosure housing the Yak, goat and sheep is broken near the entrance gate and the board is laying
in the enclosure. There is also a fence board down near the front of the enclosure housing the zebu calf. The boards
may allow the animals to become injured by exposed nails or when walking over them. The fences shall be repaired and
the loose boards removed from the enclosure to protect the animals from injury. Correct by April 18, 2023

***Access to the shed for the llama is open to a downward slope. The entire ground inside of the shed is puddled water
and mud from recent rains. The dirt and gravel has accumulated within the enclosure preventing rapid elimination of
excess water. A suitable method shall be provided to rapidly eliminate excess water. Correct by April 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
